alert.note: Alert for Eastern San Juan Mountains Above 10000 Ft; La Garita Mountains Above 10000 Ft; Upper Rio Grande Valley, Eastern San Juan Mountains Below 10000 Ft (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 03 at 4:21PM MDT by NWS Pueblo
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of west central Mineral County through 445 PM MDT... At 421 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 11 miles southwest of Creede, or 53 miles northeast of Durango, moving southeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of west central Mineral County. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
